# I'm Gonna Hire a Wino to Decorate Our Home

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

---

"**I 'm Gonna Hire a Wino to Decorate Our Home**" is a song written by
[Dewayne Blackwell](/wiki/Dewayne_Blackwell "Dewayne Blackwell") and recorded
by American country music artist [David Frizzell](/wiki/David_Frizzell "David
Frizzell"). It was released in April 1982 as the first single from the album
_The Family 's Fine, But This One's All Mine_. "I'm Gonna Hire a Wino to
Decorate Our Home" was David Frizzell's only number one on the country chart
as a solo artist. The single went to number one for one week and spent a total
of 14 weeks in country music's top 40.[1]

The song also became an unexpected mainstream pop hit in Canada, peaking at
No. 20 on the _RPM_ Top Singles chart (in addition to peaking at No. 3 on the
magazine's Top Country Tracks chart).

##
Content[[edit](/w/index.php?title=I%27m_Gonna_Hire_a_Wino_to_Decorate_Our_Home&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Content")]

The song talks of a wife who grows tired of her husband's barhopping (and
spending his entire paycheck doing so).

But instead of ending the marriage, she comes up with a unique plan â€“ she
decides to redecorate their house into a bar, and play the part of
bartender/waitress as an inducement to get her husband to stay at home (and
possibly bring his friends along with him, so they can spend _their_
paychecks). While he recovers from his [hangover](/wiki/Hangover "Hangover")
the following morning, she will deposit the proceeds in their bank account.
